azuread_application.description: Manages an Application within Azure Active Directory.

name.description: The display name for the application.

homepage.description: The URL to the application's home page. If no homepage is specified this defaults to `https://{name}`.

reply_urls.description: A list of URLs that user tokens are sent to for sign in, or the redirect URIs that OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent to.

logout_url.description: The URL of the logout page.

available_to_other_tenants.description: Is this Azure AD Application available to other tenants? Defaults to `false`.

public_client.description: Is this Azure AD Application a public client? Defaults to `false`.

oauth2_allow_implicit_flow.description: Does this Azure AD Application allow OAuth2.0 implicit flow tokens? Defaults to `false`.

group_membership_claims.description: Configures the `groups` claim issued in a user or OAuth 2.0 access token that the app expects. Defaults to `SecurityGroup`. Possible values are `None`, `SecurityGroup` or `All`.

owners.description: A list of Azure AD Object IDs that will be granted ownership of the application. Defaults to the Object ID of the caller creating the application. If a list is specified the caller Object ID will no longer be included unless explicitly added to the list.

required_resource_access.description: A collection of `required_resource_access` blocks as documented below.

type.description: Specifies whether the id property references an `OAuth2Permission` or an `AppRole`. Possible values are `Scope` or `Role`.

app_role.description: A collection of `app_role` blocks as documented below. For more information https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/architecture/multitenant-identity/app-roles

resource_app_id.description: The unique identifier for the resource that the application requires access to. This should be equal to the appId declared on the target resource application.

resource_access.description: A collection of `resource_access` blocks as documented below.

id.description: The unique identifier for one of the `OAuth2Permission` or `AppRole` instances that the resource application exposes.

allowed_member_types.description: Specifies whether this app role definition can be assigned to users and groups by setting to `User`, or to other applications (that are accessing this application in daemon service scenarios

description.description: Permission help text that appears in the admin app assignment and consent experiences.

display_name.description: Display name for the permission that appears in the admin consent and app assignment experiences.

is_enabled.description: Determines if the app role is enabled: Defaults to `true`.

value.description: Specifies the value of the roles claim that the application should expect in the authentication and access tokens.

oauth2_permissions.description: A collection of OAuth 2.0 permission scopes that the web API (resource) app exposes to client apps. Each permission is covered by a `oauth2_permission` block as documented below.

id.description: The unique identifier for one of the `OAuth2Permission`.

admin_consent_description.description: The description of the admin consent.

admin_consent_display_name.description: The display name of the admin consent.

user_consent_description.description: The description of the user consent.

user_consent_display_name.description: The display name of the user consent.
